properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continued For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Channel Inlet
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-04-16T11:15:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-04-15T11:30:58-05:00, D1CB2B8D-9D18-423B-CA0E-1F618C708511
Area: Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Update: A High Water Advisory Is Being Continued For The Saskatchewan And Carrot Rivers Near The Town Of The Pas
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre continues to issue a High Water Advisory for the Saskatchewan and Carrot Rivers near the Town of The Pas due to the potential for ice jamming. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-04-16T11:15:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-04-15T11:22:11-05:00, 33B96901-8D1D-D66E-9312-52AD1D66CEE8
Area: The Saskatchewan and Carrot Rivers near the Town of The Pas
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An extended period of snow and freezing rain is expected tonight through to Wednesday morning. Snow will develop this evening and may become heavy at times overnight, particularly on the west side of White Bay, where snowfall accumulations of up to 15 cm are possible. South and east of White Bay, snowfall amounts will be much lower, as the precipitation is expected to change over to ice pellets or freezing rain. An extended period of freezing rain is possible on Tuesday as temperatures hover near zero. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Winter storm watches are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-16T07:31:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-15T13:12:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0857317091.2019
Area: Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Between 10 and 25 centimetres of snow accumulation is expected over these areas by Tuesday morning. Snow will be heavy at times and could therefore quickly accumulate. This accumulation of snow could result in broken tree limbs. The snow will be mixed with ice pellets or rain early this evening over some areas of the Gaspe Peninsula. ### Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-16T16:30:00-00:00

properties.Title: Update: Flood Watch Continued For All Points Along The Roseau River
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Watch for all points along the Roseau River due to expected high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong southeasterly winds gusting up to 110 km/h are expected to ease by late this evening as they shift to southwesterly. ### Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-16T06:59:03-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain will change to a wintry mix of snow, ice pellets, and freezing rain tonight. A period of freezing rain is possible overnight tonight, especially over higher terrain and along Route 430 from Deer Lake to Gros Morne National Park. Precipitation will change to showers or flurries on Tuesday. A freezing rain warning is still possible in these areas. Please monitor future forecasts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-16T09:09:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-16T01:10:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1952594114.2019
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Gros Morne, Buchans and the interior, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots. A line of thunderstorms is currently moving across southwestern parts of the marine district. Although the thunderstorm activity along that line has diminished somewhat in the last few hours, the potential still exists for some of these thunderstorms to produce gusts up to 45 knots. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-04-16T01:59:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-15T18:24:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0288005346.2019
Area: Lurcher, Browns Bank, Georges Bank, Southwestern Shore, LaHave Bank, West Scotian Slope

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, heavy at times is expected. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall. An additional 10 to 20 millimetres is expected over these regions today. The heavy rain may cause flash floods and ponding on roads. Flooding is possible in low lying areas. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A major storm will hit the Lower North Shore this evening and Tuesday. We expect 30 to 50 centimetres of heavy wet snow, along with severe winds and blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. An extended period of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds is expected tonight through to Wednesday morning. Snow will develop this evening and will become heavy at times overnight tonight and continue into Tuesday. Total snowfall accumulations could exceed 30 cm in some areas by Wednesday morning, particularly inland and over higher elevations. Strong northeasterly winds gusting to between 70 and 90 km/h will accompany the snow and cause poor visibilities in blowing snow, especially on Tuesday and Tuesday night. The snow is expected to taper off by Wednesday morning but strong northerly winds will continue through the day on Wednesday. ### Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-16T05:45:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-15T13:46:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1578018786.2019
Area: Red Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, Norman Bay to Lodge Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada
